column4: How do i mount a disk in Ubuntu? (like i do in Alcohol or daemon tools in windows)
make a directory. Then sudo mount -o loop /path/to/iso /path/for/iso
if there is a space in the mounted drive, you have to escape it.
I'll give you a fixed post.
look again and copy it better.
then you put the path in incorrectly. hmm.
i copied the line at the top of the "explorer"
here's a pro-tip: don't try to use windows apps in linux, it's silly. We have a lot to use that you might love.
really? i just had this game file on the disk and i had nothing to do so i try to install it :)
it's not a linux app, so I would say not to use it in linux. I wouldn't suggest using it, but if you want to use winedb to check if they got it working first.
